title: TT variant of IPTC ninjs - News in JSON - version 1.3.  (Version 1.2 skipped to align with IPTC.)
description: A TT news item as JSON object -- Derived from https://www.iptc.org/std/ninjs/ninjs-schema_1.3.json -- (c) Copyright 2020 TT - TT Nyhetsbyrån - tt.se - This document is published under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license, see  http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/.

type.title: Type
type.description: The generic news type of this news object. $$TT: TT  added event for items with data describing a coming event.

mimetype.title: MIME type
mimetype.description: A MIME type which applies to this object

representationtype.title: Representation type
representationtype.description: Indicates how complete this representation of a news item is. $$TT: associated is a TT-extension used when the news item appears as an association considered as a link without renditions.

profile.title: Profile
profile.description: An identifier for the structure of the news object. This can be any string but we suggest something identifying the structure of the content such as 'text-only' or 'text-photo'. Profiles are typically provider-specific. nar:profile $$TT: Possible values are PUBL, DATA, INFO or RAW. PUBL is a news item that can be published. DATA is data such as tables and figures (that are not meant to be edited). INFO is for information purposes only (not to be published). RAW is raw data, such as unedited videos, that is meant to be further edited before publishing.

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the object which is identified by the uri property

firstcreated.title: First created
firstcreated.description: Indicates when the first version of the item was created. (Added in version 1.2 from issue #5). nar:firstCreated

versioncreated.title: Version created
versioncreated.description: The date and time when this version of the object was created

versionstored.title: Version stored
versionstored.description: $$TT: The date and time when this version of the object was persisted. For a photo, versioncreated is when photo was taken, versionstored is when we indexed it to the database.

embargoed.title: Embargoed
embargoed.description: The date and time before which all versions of the object are embargoed. If absent, this object is not embargoed.

embargoedreason.title: Reason for embargo
embargoedreason.description: $$TT: Textual description of why article is embargoed.

date.title: Date
date.description: $$TT Used for items that concern a specific date such as events and planning items. Notice that this holds date only, no time. See also datetime.

datetime.title: Date and time
datetime.description: $$TT For items that concern a specific date and time. See also date.

enddate.title: End date
enddate.description: $$TT Used for items that concern a specific date such as events and planning items and has a specific enddate. Notice that this holds date only, no time. See also enddatetime.

enddatetime.title: End date and time
enddatetime.description: $$TT For items that concern a specific enddate and time. See also enddate.

job.title: Job
job.description: $$TT: Identifier of a grouping job this item belongs to. Typically the id of the job the article belong to, normally something like 327890.

pubstatus.title: Publication status
pubstatus.description: The publishing status of the news object, its value is *usable* by default. $$TT: replaced and comissioned added by TT.

urgency.title: Urgency
urgency.description: The editorial urgency of the content from 1 to 9. 1 represents the highest urgency, 9 the lowest. $$TT: 1 is most urgent. 4 is normal. Definition here http://tt.se/spec/prio/1.0

copyrightholder.title: Copyright holder
copyrightholder.description: The person or organisation claiming the intellectual property for the content.

copyrightnotice.title: Copyright notice
copyrightnotice.description: Any necessary copyright notice for claiming the intellectual property for the content.

usageterms.title: Usage terms
usageterms.description: A natural-language statement about the usage terms pertaining to the content. $$TT: Specifically contains image usage restrictions from TT's suppliers.

ednote.title: Editorial note
ednote.description: A note that is intended to be read by internal staff at the receiving organisation, but not published to the end-user. (Added in version 1.2 from issue #6.) . ednote: nar:edNote  $$TT: TT will start using ednote and deprecate description_usage

language.title: Language
language.description: The human language used by the content. The value should follow IETF BCP47

week.title: Week
week.description: $$TT: The number of the week the item is planned to be published. Mainly used for feature-articles and ready pages. Also showing the week-number of planning and events.

webprio.title: Web priority
webprio.description: $TT: TT managed editorial sort order. Priority numbers range from 1 (most important) to 3 (least). A 0 indicates that the item needs manual attention before publishning. Definitions and sort logic are defined here http://tt.se/spec/webprio/1.0

source.title: Source
source.description: $$TT: String identifier for originating source of content.

commissioncode.title: Commisioncode
commissioncode.description: $$TT: String identifier for who receives commission for this object.

description_text.title: Description of text
description_text.description: $$TT: Textual description of the item as text.

description_usage.title: Description of usage
description_usage.description: $$TT: TT editorial information. Can be anything from planned re-relases of object to restrictions. (DEPRECATED, use ednote instead!)

body_text.title: Body text
body_text.description: $$TT: The textual content of the news object as untagged text. Only present if type is PUBL or DATA.

body_html5.title: Body HTML5
body_html5.description: $$TT: The textual content of the news object as HTML5. Only present if type is PUBL or DATA.

body_richhtml5.title: Body rich HTML5
body_richhtml5.description: $$TT: The textual content of the news object as HTML5. Only present if type is PUBL or DATA. See alternative html5 schemas for details. richhtml5 allow more than the older html5 container

body_event.title: Body event-data
body_event.description: $$TT: Object with properties containing data on upcoming events.

arena.title: Arena
arena.description: $$TT: Name of the arena where the event will take place.

city.title: City
city.description: $$TT: Name of the city where the event will take place.

address.title: Address
address.description: $$TT: Address to the place where the event will take place.

country.title: Country
country.description: $$TT: Three letter code for the country where the event will take place.

eventurl.title: Event URL
eventurl.description: $$TT: URL to a web site with information about the event.

eventphone.title: Event phone
eventphone.description: $$TT: Phone number to call for more information about the event.

eventweb.title: Event web
eventweb.description: $$TT: Details on following the event online

organizer.title: Organizer
organizer.description: $$TT: Name of the organizer of the event

organizeraddress.title: Organizeraddress
organizeraddress.description: $$TT: Adress of the organizer of the event

organizercity.title: Organizercity
organizercity.description: $$TT: City name of the organizer of the event

organizercountry.title: Organizer
organizercountry.description: $$TT: Country of the organizer of the event

organizerurl.title: Organizer URL
organizerurl.description: $$TT: URL to a web page for the organizer

organizerphone.title: Organizer phone
organizerphone.description: $$TT: Phone number to the organizer of the event.

organizermail.title: Organizer mail
organizermail.description: $$TT: Mail address to the organizer of the event.

eventstatus_text.title: Event status text
eventstatus_text.description: $$TT: Status for the event as a phrase.

region.title: Region code
region.description: $$TT: For events in Sweden, the code of the region.

region_text.title: Region text
region_text.description: $$TT: For events in Sweden, the name of the region.

municipality.title: Municipality code
municipality.description: $$TT: For events in Sweden, the code of the municipality.

municipality_text.title: Municipality text
municipality_text.description: $$TT: For events in Sweden the name of the municipality.

note_pm.title: Note PM
note_pm.description: $$TT: Text intended to be used by TT on planning lists of upcoming events.

accreditation.title: Accreditation
accreditation.description: $$TT: Information about how to get accreditation to the event.

extraurl.title: Extra URL
extraurl.description: $$TT: If there are more information concerning the event.

createddate.title: Created datetime
createddate.description: $$TT: When the item was created in the TT event database.

createdby.title: Created by
createdby.description: $$TT: Initials of the person creating the item in the TT event database.

changeddate.title: Changed date-time
changeddate.description: $$TT: When the item was last updated in the TT event database.

changedby.title: Changed by
changedby.description: $$TT: Initials of the person doing the last update to the item.

courtcasenumber.title: Case number in court
courtcasenumber.description: $$TT: If the event is a trial this property hold the casenumber.

body_sportsml.title: Body sportsML
body_sportsml.description: $$TT: When the news object is some form of sportsresults, table etc the data is delivered as sportsml. Only present if type is PUBL or DATA.

body_pages.title: Body of pages-info
body_pages.description: $$TT: One or more objects describing the pages in this delivery.

^[a-zA-Z0-9]+.title: Descriptive name
^[a-zA-Z0-9]+.description: $$TT: Description of one of the pages in this delivery.

innermargin.title: Inner margin
innermargin.description: $$TT: Inner margin for this page. In the unit named in unit.

bottommargin.title: Bottom margin
bottommargin.description: $$TT: Bottom margin for this page. In the unit named in unit.

pagina.title: Pagina
pagina.description: $$TT: The pagenumber, but not nescessary a number. Can be a letter too.

outermargin.title: Outer margin
outermargin.description: $$TT: Outer margin for this page. In the unit named in unit.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: $$TT: Unit in which the margins are given. Normally MM för millimeter.

topmargin.title: Top margin
topmargin.description: $$TT: Top margin for this page. In the unit named in unit.

leftmargin.title: Left margin
leftmargin.description: $$TT: Left margin for this page. In the unit named in unit.

rightmargin.title: Right margin
rightmargin.description: $$TT: Right margin for this page. In the unit named in unit.

commissionedby.title: Commissioned by
commissionedby.description: $$TT: When pubstatus is 'commissioned', this field tells who commissioned it.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the person

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the person

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the person in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property. $$TT: http://tt.se/spec/person/1.0

organisation.title: Organisation
organisation.description: An administrative and functional structure which may act as as a business, as a political party or not-for-profit party. nar:subject

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the organisation

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the organisation

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the organisation in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

symbols.title: Symbols
symbols.description: Symbols used for a financial instrument linked to the organisation at a specific market place

ticker.title: Ticker
ticker.description: Ticker symbol used for the financial instrument

exchange.title: Exchange
exchange.description: Identifier for the marketplace which uses the ticker symbols of the ticker property

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the place

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the place. $$TT: http://tt.se/spec/place/1.0

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the place in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

geometry_geojson.title: Geometry GeoJSON
geometry_geojson.description: $$TT: An optional GeoJSON description of the place.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: A concept with a relationship to the content. $$TT: Used for content classification in swedish equivalent of IPTC Subject Reference see http://tt.se/spec/subref/1.0/ etc

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the subject

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the subject. $$TT: http://tt.se/spec/subref/1.0/ http://tt.se/spec/keyword/1.0/  http://tt.se/spec/eventtype/1.1/

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the subject in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

event.title: Event
event.description: Something which happens in a planned or unplanned manner. nar:?

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the event

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the event

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the event in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the object

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the object

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the object in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

infosource.title: Info source
infosource.description: A party (person or organisation) which originated, modified, enhanced, distributed, aggregated or supplied the content or provided some information used to create or enhance the content. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #15.) .    infosource:  nar:infoSource

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the infosource

scheme.title: Schema
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the infosource

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the infosource in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

title.title: Title
title.description: A short natural-language name for the item. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #9). nar:itemMeta/title

byline.title: Byline
byline.description: The name(s) of the creator(s) of the content

bylines.title: Bylines
bylines.description: Holder of one or more byline objects.

byline.title: Byline
byline.description: When the complete byline is sent as one string. Same as byline on root level. Example: Albert Jonsson/SvD/TT

firstname.title: First name
firstname.description: When byline is divided, holds the first name of the person. Example: Albert

lastname.title: Last name
lastname.description: When byline is divided, holds the last name of the person. Example: Jonsson

role.title: Role
role.description: Role of the person in the byline in relation to this ttninjs item, as string. Example: Photographer

email.title: Email
email.description: Email address of the person in this byline. albert.jonsson@acme.com

jobtitle.title: Job title
jobtitle.description: Jobtitle can differ from role and is normally more connected to the person and not to the combination person-newsItem. Example: Editor in Chief

internal.title: Internal
internal.description: Whether byline is for internal purposes. Example: true. If not present it means false.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: Phone number of the person in this byline. Example: +46555123456

initials.title: Initials
initials.description: Initials of byline. Mainly used for records marked as internal. Example: mag

affiliation.description: The affiliation of the person. Example: SvD/TT

headline.title: Headline
headline.description: A brief and snappy introduction to the content, designed to catch the reader's attention

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: $$TT: Short name given to article while in production. (DEPRECTED, use slugline instead.)

slugline.title: Slugline
slugline.description: A human-readable identifier for the item. (Added in version 1.2 from issue #4.). nar:slugline  $$TT: TT will use slugline and deprecate slug.

located.title: Located
located.description: The name of the location from which the content originates.

charcount.title: Character count
charcount.description: The total character count in the article excluding figure captions. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #27.). nar:charcount $$TT: The total character count in the article excluding figure captions.

wordcount.title: Word count
wordcount.description: The total number of words in the article excluding figure captions. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #27.). nar:wordcount

renditions.title: Renditions
renditions.description: Wrapper for different renditions of non-textual content of the news object

^[a-zA-Z0-9]+.title: Rendition identifier
^[a-zA-Z0-9]+.description: A specific rendition of a non-textual content of the news object.

href.title: HREF
href.description: The URL for accessing the rendition as a resource

mimetype.title: MIME type
mimetype.description: A MIME type which applies to the rendition

title.title: Title
title.description: A title for the link to the rendition resource

height.title: Height
height.description: For still and moving images: the height of the display area measured in $$TT: unit and defaults to pixels

width.title: Width
width.description: For still and moving images: the width of the display area measured in $$TT: unit and defaults to pixels

sizeinbytes.title: Size in bytes
sizeinbytes.description: The size of the rendition resource in bytes

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: $$TT: The unit for width/height. Either px or mm

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The total time duration of the content in seconds. (Added in version 1.2. Issue #18). nar:remoteContent@duration  $$TT: Video clip curation in seconds.

format.title: Format
format.description: Binary format name. (Added in version 1.2. Issue #18). nar:remoteContent@format

printsize.title: Print size
printsize.description: Calculated size of a 300 dpi upsampled image

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: Content of news objects which are associated with this news object.

altids.title: Alternative id
altids.description: Alternative identifiers of the item. It is up to the individual provider to name and set type on the alternative identifiers they like to use. nar:altId issue #3. (Added in version 1.3)

originaltransmissionreference.title: Original transmission reference
originaltransmissionreference.description: $$TT: Identifier in the originating system/source. TT will move originaltransmissionreference here.
$$TT: Identifier in the originating system/source. DEPRECATED: Will be handled as an altid

trustindicator.title: Trust indicator
trustindicator.description: An array of objects to allow links to documents about trust indicators. (nar:link) issue #44. (Added in version 1.3)

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the trust indicator

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the trust indicator in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the resource being referenced.

href.title: href
href.description: The URL for accessing the trust indicator resource.

$standard.title: Standard
$standard.description: An object with information about standard, version and schema this instance is valid against. nar:standard, nar:standardversion and xml:schema issue #43. (Added in version 1.3)

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: The uri of the json schema to use for validation.

genre.title: Genre
genre.description: A nature, intellectual or journalistic form of the content. nar:genre. (Added in version 1.3)  $$TT: TT will move sector to genre and deprecate sector.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the genre. Normally  http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/genre/

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the genre in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property

signals.title: Signals
signals.description: $$TT: signals is suggested by AP but not yet included in ninjs. When included it will probably hold a large number of properties.

pageproduct.title: Page product
pageproduct.description: $$TT: What type of page product. An abbreviation like IURDAG.

multipagecount.title: Multipage count
multipagecount.description: $$TT: Number of pages in this delivery.

paginae.title: Paginae
paginae.description: $$TT: Array of pagenumbers for the pages in this delivery. (A pagenumber can also be a letter.)

product.title: Product
product.description: $$TT: TT Product classification codes. See http://tt.se/spec/product/1.0

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the product code. "Feature Fritid", "Nyheter Nöje", etc

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the product. http://tt.se/spec/product/1.0

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the subject in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property. "FTFRI", "TTNJE"

replacing.title: Replacing
replacing.description: $$TT: Array of identifiers of news objects this object is replacing.

replacedby.title: Replaced by
replacedby.description: $$TT: The identifier of the news object this one is replaced by.

assignments.title: Assignments
assignments.description: Individual assignments to produce content connected with one planning item.

revisions.title: Revisions
revisions.description: $$TT: Array of previous versions of this news object. See http://spec.tt.se/revisions.html

uri.title: URI
uri.description: $$TT: The identifier of the previous revision.

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: $$TT: Short name given to article while in production.

replacing.title: Replacing
replacing.description: $$TT: Array of identifiers this revision is replacing.

sector.title: Sector
sector.description: $$TT: Designator for the 'big 5' ways of grouping content (inrikes, utrikes, etc) and PRM for press releases. Not mandatory, often omitted. DEPRECATED and moved to genre.

fixture.title: Fixture
fixture.description: $$TT: A storytag that this item belong to. A sort of grouping name that can be used over time for a running story. Broader than a slugline, narrower than a media topic.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content to the fixture

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which includes a code for the subject. $$TT: http://tt.se/spec/story/1.1/

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the story in a scheme (= controlled vocabulary) which is identified by the scheme property.

advice.title: Advices
advice.description: Editorial advice to the receiver of the news object. Only in dev so far. Tests with the C-POP project.

importance.description: Advice regarding the importance of the content from an emotional perspective. Experimental vocabulary, part of the C-POP project.

code.description: Present values are: essential, useful and entertaining.

lifetime.description: Advice regarding the length of time that the content is considered to be relevant. Experimental vocabulary, part of the C-POP project.

code.description: Present values are: short, medium, long and evergreen.
